description.narrative:
Association for Water, Applied Education <(>&<)> Renewable Energy- AWARE
The Strategic Partnership project will contribute to ensuring that women have a say in local water related peace building processes and policies and their say in considered in water relatedaspects in Sindh Province by adopting the issues/disputes resolution strategy to influence policy change and empowerment of people and CSOs to claim their rights and involved in peace building process of water disputes. The project will target areasof Akram Wah Division, including the District Hyderabad, Badin and Tando Muhammad Khan of Sindh province.
The Association for Water, Applied Education <(>&<)> Renewable Energy- AWARE is implementing the project in two districts of Sindh i.e. Tando Muhammad Khan and Badin.
Outcomes and outputs Nr.3200) Improved policies Governments and Global actors: a. 01 case where Oxfam and # of partners influencing has contributed to (sub) national governments/ global actors addressing root causes of conflict b. 08 case studies, 01 (Project) video documentary, and 01 policy brief as pieces of evidence produced by Oxfam or partners in support of development/adoption of alternative policies/approaches c. 08 case studies, 01 video documentary, and 01 policy briefas pieces of evidence produced by Oxfam or partners to support monitoring of practices and implementation of policies by governments and global actors. Nr. 3120) Strengthened CSOs a. 01 CSOs increasingly participate in or initiate influencing and advocacy efforts to contribute to conflict transformation,/address root causes of conflict; b. 01 Organisations supported with means (financial, knowledge, skills, networks, training etc.) to strengthen capacity in specific areas. c. 02 of networks (district level) provided with secretariat support (i.e. stationary, meeting space etc) Nr. 3240) Increased citizens' voice a. 74 of women take action to contribute to conflict transformation/address rootcauses of conflict following Oxfam /partners# actions b. 172 men take action to contribute to conflict transformation/address root causes of conflict following Oxfam /partners# actions c. 06 people (men and women) take action to contribute to conflict transformation/address root causes of conflict followingOxfam /partners# actions. d. 240 women and men participating in public events / spaces organised by Oxfam or partners e. 518 of public events/spaces organised by Oxfam or partners in whichcitizens express their needs and aspirations to policy makers. f. # media citations of Oxfam or partners# research or products Nr. 3250) Stronger and wider alliances a. 02 cases in which Oxfam or partners have strengthened and/or broadened alliances in order to contribute to conflict transformation/address rootcauses of conflict. b. 02 cases in which Oxfam or partners supported joint agendas of networks and alliances. c. 38 stakeholder sessions organised by Oxfam or partners. d. 846 (men <(>&<)> women) participants in stakeholder sessions organised by Oxfam orpartners. Nr. 3130) Increased political will a. # of cases of influential endorsing gender sensitive policies asks of Oxfam/ partner towards conflict transformation b. 01 of alternative policies/approaches presented by Oxfam, or international personsor institutions b. 02 campaigns in which Oxfam, or partners participated Nr. 3170) Shifted norms and attitudes a. 72 Women, includingpeople living in poverty and injustice, consider inclusion in water governance and related peacebuilding and policy processes fundamental right for women and men. b. 168 Men, including people living in poverty and injustice, consider inclusion in water governanceand related peacebuilding and policy processes fundamental right for women and men. c. 10 of role models /frontrunners expressing their views during events or on platforms organised by Oxfam, or partners

participating-org.narrative:
AWARE (Association for Water Applied Education & Advocacy) has extensive professional local NGO is promoting education through alternative energy. The vision of AWARE is to be an endeavoring and an effective contributor to the establishment of a society, where people determine their choices in life and influence the direction of change is proactive to empower communities for improvement of their social and economic conditions through different sources. Aware mission is to organize, aware, strengthen andempower the marginalized sectors of population to enabling them to influence social, political and economic policies and decision making to make possible to establish a society based on social justice, equity, equality and human dignity.
The objective of Aware is to organize different sectors of population in order to involve the community in: identifying, understanding the community needs; identification, development, management and judicious use of natural resources particularly renewable energy resources; and development, management, improvement and maintenance of public facilities.To provide the people suitable economic and research activities to build their development, management and leadership capacities/capabilities and to improve/develop their occupational/professional skills so as to strengthen their economic position. The area of operation is Sindh province but at present the focus is on two Districts; Tharparkar andUmerkot. Renewable Energy and Applied Education are focused for poverty reduction. An intensive study of underground water quality in Thar is conducted with support of Pakistan Council of Scientific & Industrial Research (PCSIR) Laboratories Complex Karachi, Neuro Medicine Department of Dow Medical University Karachi, Geology Department of Karachi University, an intensive study of water quality in Thar was conducted and this took more than 05 years in completion. AWARE is striving for empowerment of the excluded and the marginalized segments of society and to reform their social and economic conditions.
Association for Water, Applied Educ & Renewable Energy
